Translations.Text: Does not enter it except Al-Ashqa
that one who denied and turned away (from Al-Kitab)
And soon — Al-Atqa shall be kept away from it —
that one who spends his wealth: he sanctifies (himself)
and with him (i.e., Al-Atqa) there is not for any one out of a reward, which may be paid (by him, as due) in return (for any good some one has done to this pious and obedient person) —
except a desire to seek the attention of his Nourisher-Sustainer, the Most High
And surely, very soon he will be pleased (in the Hereafter)
Early forenoon brightness acts as a witness
and the night when it has completely set in (to its full darkness)
Your Rabb has not forsaken you and has not disagreed (with you)
And indeed, the Hereafter is better for you than the initial
And verily, very soon your Rabb shall bestow unto you (His Grace in various forms), then you shall be well pleased
Did He not find you yatim (a weak personality, an orphan), then He established you (in life)
And He found you lost (in search of the Code in Al-Kitab), then He provided you Guidance
And He found you ‘hand to mouth’, then He made you reasonably rich
So that one who is Al-Yatim, then rebuff (him) not
And that who is As-Sâil (compelled to ask for assistance), then repulse (him) not
And that whatever (is with you) from the Grace of your Nourisher-Sustainer, so narrate (it and do not hide)
Have We not widened for you, your chest (i.e., made your heart receptive to the Message)
and removed from you your burden (of man-created religion, traditions and Fiqh) —
that which had almost broken your back
And We exalted in your interest, Zikr ('Message') revealed unto you. (See Verse)
So, without doubt, linked with hard endeavour, is relief and ease
Surely, following hardship is relief
So whenever you became free, get attached to the ideal target (i.e., understanding, adopting and propagating Al-Kitab)
and to your Nourisher-Sustainer, then you (must) get attached
